DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate whether ultrasonography guidance compare with the simple radiography aids in determining the adequacy of distal radius fracture reduction.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluating Validity of Ultrasonography in Determining Distal Radius Fracture Reduction
DOC.detailed_description: Distal radius fracture is one of the most common causes for visiting the emergency department. Nowadays, simple radiography is used as a control standard for evaluating reduction of distal radius fractures. The disadvantages include time wasting, frequent x-ray exposures and use of more sedation in determining adequate reduction, made scientists to evaluate alternative method such as ultrasonography which fast, easy and less dangerous were considered as advantages. The investigators goal was to identify whether ultrasonography guidance compare with the simple radiography aids in determining the adequacy of distal radius fracture reduction.
DOC.criteria: > 21 years old and a diagnosing of a distal radius fracture based on simple radiography. Open fractures more than 20 degree angulation joint internal involvement, communicated and along with Neurovascular compromised fractures patient's surgery due to other causes need to stay in the ICU and not being able to be treated at the same time for distal radius fracture patient's refusal to participate in the study
